listing.description: Overview  A well presented semi-detached house situated on Corrigan Avenue, CR5. The property offers off road parking, a garage and plenty of internal space. The property is a 2 minute walk from the Corrigan recreational ground with a childs play park and childrens football on the weekends. Call us now for more information, we are *Open 8am - 8pm 7 Days a Week*location  Situated in a quiet cul-de-sac in Coulsdon, CR5. There are excellent schools in the local area with popular options locally in both the state and private sectors.Porch  A handy porch with wooden flooring and double glazing. The original oak front door opens into the property.Entrance hall  An entrance hall with parquet flooring, a carpeted staircase to the first floor and a radiator. There are double glazed doors through to the conservatory.Conservatory 17' 0" x 9' 3" (5.18m x 2.82m) A conservatory with tiled flooring, double glazing throughout, a radiator and a door out to the patio.Bedroom one 18' 0" x 14' 10" (5.49m x 4.52m) Situated on the top floor is a master bedroom with carpeted flooring, a built-in wardrobe a rear facing double glazed window plus a further Velux and a radiator.Ensuite  An ensuite with wood effect flooring, a low level flush W/C, a hand basin, a shower cubicle with a power shower attachment, a heated towel rail, an extractor fan and a Velux window.Bedroom two 16' 6" x 11' 0" (5.03m x 3.35m) A second spacious double bedroom with carpeted flooring, a bay fronted double glazed window and a radiator.Bedroom three 14' 0" x 11' 0" (4.27m x 3.35m) A third spacious double bedroom with carpeted flooring, a rear facing double glazed window, an airing cupboard and a radiator.Bedroom four 7' 6" x 7' 5" (2.29m x 2.26m) A fourth bedroom with wood effect flooring, a double glazed window and a radiator.Family bathroom  A family bathroom with carpeted flooring, a corner bath with a power shower, a pedestal hand basin, a frosted double glazed window, an airing cupboard and a heated towel rail.A separate toilet with laminate flooring, a W/C, a frosted double glazed window and a radiator.Outside  To the front is a pebbled driveway with parking for two cars. There is a side access down to a single garage.To the rear is a garden mainly laid to lawn with a pond, a patio, a veg patch and a greenhouse with mature shrub boarders. There is a large shed with electrics and lighting.Platform note  Mains services. Gas central heating. listing.description: Open day by appointment only.An immaculately presented and rarely available two double bedroom terraced house. Set in a wonderfully secluded mews on the private Cator Estate in Blackheath. This bright, two-bedroom terraced Span house with private garden. Designed by Eric Lyons Cunningham Partnership in 1984, the house is one of 15 that make up Streetfield Mews.The property has been extensively refurbished and is in excellent decorative order. The accommodation comprises an entrance porch which leads to a large living room with feature windows to the front and a stunning newly fitted high spec modern kitchen. Upstairs are two double bedrooms and a newly fitted attractive modern bathroom. To the rear of the property is a 60ft landscaped garden. The property further benefits from a garage en-bloc and communal access to a fantastic private meadow and use of the allotment exclusive for the residents of Streetfield Mews.Streetfield Mews is located just off the sought-after Blackheath Park on the private Cator Estate. It is located just 0.1 miles from the Ofsted outstanding Brooklands Primary school and 0.5 miles from Blackheath Village with its array of boutique shops, restaurants, bars and mainline Station with direct access to Central London.

listing.description: A delightful character detached five bedroom family home with a host of original features, located in a sought after residential road in South Cheam within close proximity to Cheam Village with its array of shops, restaurants and cafes as well as easy access to Cheam Village and Belmont British Rail stations. With an overall floor space of 2196 sq ft (203 sq meters) this charming house has an inviting original double front door which opens into a large hallway immediately drawing the eyes to the beamed ceilings which lend to the character and style that flows throughout this property. There are three large reception rooms including a family room at the rear, with double doors leading on to a stunning 110 ft rear garden beautifully laid to lawn with mature trees and high bordering hedges giving a secluded and private outlook, together with a brick built outhouse at the rear, this sunny East facing garden has also a great size patio, an ideal environment for relaxing and entertaining. Back inside the house, you will find that the cornerstone of this home is the country style kitchen with a bespoke Mark Wilkinson range of units creating a cosy family living area offering superb views of the garden. Completing the ground floor living space is a downstairs wc and ample built in coat and storage cupboards in the hallway. Upstairs you will find a large master bedroom with ensuite bathroom, four bedrooms and a family bathroom. To the front of the house there is a driveway with parking for several cars and a garden with mature trees and shrubs ensuring privacy. The property is located within South Cheam which is an extremely sought after and affluent district of the Greater London Borough of Sutton. The area is abundant in wide open green spaces, the magnificent Nonsuch Park being in close proximity, as well as several gyms and leisure centres within easy access and excellent local schooling options providing the suburban ideal for families. This house is simply a must view and promises to be one of the best available in Cheam and surrounding areas.

listing.description: A beautifully designed, expertly finished three bedroom family home on the borders of Walthamstow Village. Smart designer touches and original period features combine to create a home simultaneously stylish and welcoming, and you have everything that makes Walthamstow so special right on your doorstep.From the lovingly preserved original floorboards underfoot, to the lounge's exposed brick chimney breast, to the vintage bathroom fittings and cutting edge kitchen appliances, the love, care and attention to detail that's been lavished upon the property is apparent both inside and out.If you lived here...You'll be falling in love with the open-plan ground floor, 485 square feet with clear sightlines from the front bay window to the concertina patio doors at the back, and with a metro tiled chef's bar subtly demarking the kitchen area. Flooded with light and utterly gorgeous from end to end it's a great, flexible space ideal for entertaining, dinner parties and family time.Thanks to those extra wide doors, the whole space can be opened up to the expertly landscaped garden, featuring a raised decking area, lush lawn and a large cabin at the end. Upstairs you have two large double bedrooms and one single, all finihsed to the same exacting standards. The bathroom is particularly stunning with vintage fittings, metro tiling and a rainfall shower over a free-standing bathtub.The very heart of Walthamstow Village, an oasis of part-pedestrianised streets, peaceful greenery and historic architecture, is just moments away. Here's where you'll find some of the finest independent pubs, bars and gastropubs for miles around. Smart designer touches and original period features combine to create a home simultaneously stylish and welcoming, and you have everything that makes Walthamstow so special right on your doorstep. Flooded with light and utterly gorgeous from end to end it's a great, flexible space ideal for entertaining, dinner parties and family time. Thanks to those extra wide doors, the whole space can be opened up to the expertly landscaped garden, featuring a raised decking area, lush lawn and a large cabin at the end. Upstairs you have two large double bedrooms and one single, all finihsed to the same exacting standards. The bathroom is particularly stunning with vintage fittings, metro tiling and a rainfall shower over a free-standing bathtub. listing.description: This is a very rare opportunity to acquire a truly stunning converted Penthouse apartment located within Hampton Conservation area. This amazing apartment is situated within a newly converted building offering bright and spacious accommodation throughout. The property compromises of open planned living as well as a newly fitted modern kitchen which includes integrated "neff" oven, hob and extractor hood. The property is a beautifully presented two bedroom apartment with the master bedroom having direct access to a pristine en-suite as well as fitted wardrobes. The second bedroom allows access to the fantastic balcony space to which only this apartment has access to. The apartment also compromises of features such as under floor heating, comfort cooling and heating system as well as bespoke designer feature light and beautiful vaulted ceiling in lounge area. The property is located within walking distance to Hampton Train station providing access to London Waterloo as well as being on the highly sought after 111,285 and 490 bus routes providing access to London Heathrow, Kingston and Hampton Hill.

We have been favoured with the Sole agency instructions on this deceptively spacious four / five bedroom bedroom semi detached house arranged over three floors, extending to nearly 1948 Sq. Ft / 181 Sq. M Comprising of spacious Hallway with Guest cloakroom, two intercommunicating reception rooms, plus additional Dining room, kitchen and large utility room. On the first floor there are two large double bedrooms and a large single bedroom a shower room and a bathroom. listing.description: A bright, airy and well planned three bedroom garden apartment set within this end of terrace Victorian House. At 833 sq ft accommodation comprises master bedroom with an en-suite shower room with underfloor heating, two further well-proportioned bedrooms and a full family bathroom also with underfloor heating.  There is a large eat in kitchen diner leading to the extended reception room having direct access out to the delightful 27??? South West facing private garden. Other major benefits are having the sole use of the cellar for extra storage and included is a newly extended lease. Shirlock Road is probably the most sought after street in the heart of Mansfield conservation area with access onto Hampstead Heath literally at the end of the road. Additionally within a reasonable walking distance are various transport links to include overground rail, Belsize Park Underground (Northern Line) and many bus routes to and from the city. Subject to the necessary planning consent there is also a good possibility to extend to the side and the rear of the property thus creating even more internal space. There are two outstanding schools within 5 minutes walk of this family home. Viewing highly recommended.
listing.short_description: A bright, airy and well planned three bedroom garden apartment set within this end of terrace Victorian House...

listing.description: Brackenbury GroveShow home now openA unique opportunity to purchase this three bedroom luxury Town House in the exquisite new gated development, Brackenbury Grove, off Brackenbury Road.A light and spacious open plan kitchen/dining/living space, leading on to a private courtyard ideal for entertaining family and friends.The living space boasts a double height ceiling with a floor to ceiling window to maximise the light and space. There is also a useful storage cupboard located under the stairs, and a separate cloakroom to the ground floor.Leading up the stairs to a study area with glass minstrel balcony overlooking the living area below. Also located on this floor, a spacious double bedroom and a beautifully finished family bathroom.Located on the second floor you will find a further two double bedrooms each with ensuite shower rooms.The town house is fitted with underfloor heating, smart technology and comes with an allocated underground parking space. Concierge is located within this development.Hidden away behind walled gardens in a newly created modern and leafy setting, these sharp modern spaces occupy a location in one of London's most charming and secret urban villages. Brackenbury Grove is the perfect fusion of cutting edge design and rewarding city life.With 4 main tube and train lines, bus routes and road connections all within easy reach, Farrington within 25 minutes, Westfield in less than 10 minutes and Heathrow a 28 minute drive away, the travel possibilities are endless.Our Sales and Marketing Suite is open every day from 10am - 5pm with late night on Thursday until 7pm. Call today to receive further information on this fantastic development.

This stunning four bedroom home (circa 1590sqft) offers light and airy living accommodation throughout boasting an open plan reception room, dining area and family kitchen comprising Hacker units, Silestone worktops and aeg appliances on the ground floor. In addition there is a downstairs WC, four double bedrooms each with built in wardrobes plus ensuite bathroom / shower room to each bedroom. Further benefits include off road parking, under floor heating throughout and a private Southerly aspect rear garden. The property is located in close proximity to Surbiton???s Mainline station and local amenities.

listing.letting_fees:
What fees can I expect to pay if I rent a property with Hawes & Co?

When you have agreed on the property of your choice, Hawes & Co will provide you with an Offer acceptance Form. This helps explain not only the next stages of your application but any fee which is due before you sign your Tenancy Agreement and any fees which may become payable during and after the tenancy. This will also include confirmation of the agreed rent and the security deposit.

Below is a list of our current fee scales. This list is a guide only as many vary depending on the size of the property. At any time you are interested in a property, please ask a member of staff for a full breakdown of fees that may be payable before, during and after a tenancy.

Most fees shown are Inclusive of VAT at 20% unless stated otherwise

Fees 'before' moving in

Reservation Fee

??500 Holding deposit

Fees 'for' moving in

Administration Fee per person

??234

Check Out Fee

??100-350 (depending on property size)

Additional fees which may become payable to some applicants ???

Guarantor's Referencing

??120 (per guarantor)

Permitted occupiers

??120 (per occupier)

Amendments to the Agreement/Added Clauses

??60

Fees 'after' moving in

Extension fee

??120

Amendments to the Contract

??60

Rent Arrears

??30 Incl VAT for the 1st & each subsequent 7 day arrears letter sent plus interest on overdue rent as per the contract signed

Early Termination Fee

??300 Incl VAT arrangement fees plus liability for rent until the day a new tenant commences tenancy plus any fees usually payable by the landlord (at the landlord???s discretion)

End of Tenancy reference request

??60 per person
listing.description: A well-presented and extended, 3 bedroom Victorian house, situated in a popular residential road. The property benefits from a double reception room, kitchen/breakfast room, downstairs W.C and utility room, family bathroom, 3 good sized double bedrooms, in excess of 100 ft. Rear garden and off road parking.The property is conveniently placed with shops, amenities, transport links and schooling close to hand. Surbiton mainline railway station with its fast and frequent link to Waterloo is also within easy reach.

listing.description: A light and Spacious Two double Bedroom apartment in Rennie Court a well maintained and prestigious block.This stunning two double bedroom flat on the 10th floor (with lifts) has 24 hour concierge and secure underground parking. Offering 945 sq ft of living space, the flat comprises a, entrance hall with fitted wardrobes for hanging and extra storage, a further storage cupboard, two good sized double bedrooms each with fitted wardrobes, a floor to ceiling tiled bathroom with shower and mixer tap, a large reception room with access to the balcony over looking the well maintained communal gardens, a contemporary fully fitted kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine. The Property is being offered with a long lease of approximately 160 years unexpired.Rennie Court is conveniently located between Waterloo and Blackfriars bridges, on the South side of the Thames, moments away from the river and all the shops bars and restaurants the area has to offer. Waterloo, Blackfriars (Mainline & Underground Stations) Southwark (Undergorund Station) are approximately a 5 minute walk away.
